text: - I think my military background,
I think that one of the biggest things
is working together on teams.
Teams is a big part of the AWS culture,
and I think that you can't be successful
without working on teams here.
So I think the big transferable skill
that I learned in the military
is you can't do anything by yourself.
You have to bring people along with you,

and I think that's one
of the great environments

that we create in our culture
is that we can enlist people

to come and join our
team, and sell our team
and sell our ideas to build a great team,
and a successful team and raise the bar.

And so the military does a
good job of that by bootcamp,
A schools, B schools, C schools

that you have the same opportunity
to join different teams.
So when you sign up for the military,
you may decide to be a cook,
you may decide to be a boats inmate,
you may decide to be a dispersing clerk.
You may decide to be a special forces
or whatever the case may be,

but you're able to enlist on
different teams after you join.

AWS is the same great environment
and create great culture.

If you wanna be on the
software development team,
you can join the team.

You can join in marketing,
you can join operations.
So it allows you to grow.
And then if you wanna transfer
and move and do something different

because you feel like, Hey, I
wanna try something different,
it enables you to do that.

And it creates an environment
where you have all kind

of opportunities open to
you at different points
in your career.
(pleasant upbeat music)
